stretch.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to make something bigger or looser by pulling it, or to become bigger or looser as a result of being pulled
stretch.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: A spider’s web can stretch considerably without weakening.
Where can I buy those things that stretch your shoes?
stretch.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if a material stretches, it can become bigger or longer when you pull it and then return to its original shape when you stop
stretch.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to straighten your arms, legs, or body to full length
stretch.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Carl sat up in bed, yawned, and stretched.
stretch.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to reach a long way for something
stretch.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Ann stretched across the couch and grabbed the phone.
stretch.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to pull something so that it is tight
stretch.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: The canvas is stretched over a wooden frame.
stretch.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to continue over a period of time or in a series, or to make something do this
stretch.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: Berg’s career as a government official stretched over 20 years.
With a goal in the second half, Spurs stretched their lead to 3–0.
stretch.translation[0].definitions[6].de: to spread out or cover a large area of land
stretch.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: Row after row of orange trees stretched to the horizon.
a line stretching around the block
stretch.translation[0].definitions[7].de: to allow something that would not normally be allowed by a rule or limit
stretch.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: This once, I’ll stretch the rules and let you leave work early.
We’ll stretch a point (=allow a rule to be broken) and let the baby travel free this time.
stretch.translation[0].definitions[8].de: if you make an amount of money, food etc stretch or it stretches, you use less of it than you usually would so that you have it for a longer time
stretch.translation[0].definitions[8].ex: I’m going to have to stretch this $20 until payday.
stretch.translation[0].definitions[9].de: to make someone use all of their skill, abilities, or intelligence
stretch.translation[0].definitions[9].ex: The work’s too easy. The students aren’t being stretched enough.
stretch.translation[1].definitions[0].de: an area of land or water, especially one that is long and narrow
stretch.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: She doesn’t leave the house for long stretches of time.
She rarely sleeps for eight hours at a stretch (=without stopping).
a stretch of three weeks without sunshine
stretch.translation[1].definitions[2].de: the action of stretching a part of your body out to its full length, or a particular way of doing this
stretch.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: The ski instructor showed us some special stretches.
stretch.translation[1].definitions[3].de: the ability a material has to increase in length or width without tearing
stretch.translation[1].definitions[4].de: a period of time spent in prison
stretch.translation[2].definitions[0].de: stretch clothes or material stretch if you pull them, and then return to their original shape
stretch.translation[3].definitions[0].de: if something stretches an amount of money or a supply of something, it uses it up so you have hardly enough for your needs
stretch.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: Our finances are stretched to the limit.
stretch.translation[3].definitions[1].de: to make an amount of money last longer than usual by being careful how it is spent and not wasting it
stretch.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: All departments are having to stretch their budgets.
stretch.translation[3].definitions[2].de: if a company stretches a brand, it starts to use an existing brand name on a different type of product, hoping that people will buy it because they recognize the name
stretch.translation[3].definitions[2].ex: Following Coca-Cola’s decision to market clothes, people asked how far a brand can be stretched.
